data.title: Lorna Doone an Exmoor Romance Illustrated by R D Blackmore
data.meta_description: Lorna Doone : a romance of Exmoor. By: R. D. Blackmore (complete in two volume), (illustrated): It is a romance based on a group of historical . around the East Lyn Valley area of Exmoor. by Blackmore, R. D. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
LeatherBound. Condition: New. Leatherbound edition. Condition: New. Leather Binding on Spine and Corners with Golden leaf printing on spine. Bound in genuine leather with Satin ribbon page markers and Spine with raised gilt bands. A perfect gift for your loved ones. Reprinted from 1921 edition. NO changes have been made to the original text. This is NOT a retyped or an ocr'd reprint. Illustrations, Index, if any, are included in black and white. Each page is checked manually before printing. As this print on demand book is reprinted from a very old book, there could be some missing or flawed pages, but we always try to make the book as complete as possible. Fold-outs, if any, are not part of the book. If the original book was published in multiple volumes then this reprint is of only one volume, not the whole set. IF YOU WISH TO ORDER PARTICULAR VOLUME OR ALL THE VOLUMES YOU CAN CONTACT US. Resized as per current standards. Sewing binding for longer life, where the book block is actually sewn (smythe sewn/section sewn) with thread before binding which results in a more durable type of binding. Pages: 404 Language: English Pages: 404.

Hardcover - Illustrated edition. With illustrations from photographs of the Doone Country together with an introductory biographical sketch of the author by Basil Davenport. ages. Although the author considered this a work of romance based on "the nurse tales of his childhood - the savage deeds of the outlaw Doones in the depth of Bagworthy forest, the beauty of the hapless maid brought up in the midst of them. . ." rather than an historical novel, it did include real events and Blackmore was known for the care he took in depicting the speech of his characters. Set in the late 17th century in the area around Somerset and Devon, this was originally published anonymously in three volumes in 1869 - when it reprinted the following year in a one-volume edition, it was immediately successful and has not been out of print since. This is a handsome edition in the Great Illustrated Classics of the early 1950s, bound in tan cloth with a red cloth spine with a burgundy title panel and decorations and lettering in gilt. 646 pp. Near fine in a very good dust jacket. (sunning to the spine of the dj, as is common with this series, some short closed edgetears).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Blackmore, R. D. Lorna Doone: a romance of Exmoor / illustrated by Gordon Browne. London: W. and R. Chambers, s.d., circa 1911. 1st edition thus. Gilt blocked decorative blue cloth with bevelled edges, bumped to corners and the colour image on the front slightly rubbed. Top edge of text block in gilt. Spine has slight damage to top and bottom and some of the stitching visible through the cloth on the rear hinge. Binding strong. Grey endpapers; front endpaper has a gift inscription dated January 1912. Illustrated title page in colour. 634pp., b/w illustrations throughout. Mild discolouration to edges of text block; contents clean and bright. 26.5cm x 19.5cm approx. Gordon Frederick Browne RI RBA (15 April 1858 27 May 1932) was an English artist and a prolific illustrator of children's books in the late 19th century and early 20th century. He was a meticulous craftsman and went to a great deal of effort to ensure that his illustrations were accurate. he provided the illustrations for the Henry Irving Shakespear, 1895. RightWayUp Books aims to provide accurate and detailed descriptions. All images are of the actual book for sale - no stock images are ever used. Thank you for looking at this listing.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Later Edition. No date. Circa 1890. Complete two volume set. Illustrated with captioned-red-titled tissue-guarded photographs by Dr. Charles L. Mitchell, Philadelphia and F. Frith & Co. Reigate, Surrey, England. Photogravures by A. W. Elson & Co. Boston throughout the two volumes including frontispiece to Volume I: Entrance to Lorna Doone and a photogravure portrait of Lorna Doone to Vol II. ***Vol I: Twenty-seven plates; Vol II: twenty-four plates. With a two-page preface to the twentieth edition to the fore of volume I by the author, dated October, 1882. ***Both volumes very good in pale cream cloth-covered boards with elaborate gilt illustrated and bordered spine and front boards. Top edges gilt. Boards clean and bright. No inscriptions. Pages clean. Small bump to bottom corner of rear board to volume I. Please note that the interior hinges of volume II have exposed webbing (common to this set, due to the heaviness of the quality paper used - to accommodate the many photographic illustrations. Spine to Volume II still tight. ***Both volumes very good in the original publisher's plain thick red cloth dustwrappers with gilt titles to spine, preserving the bright gilt illustrated cream boards beneath. Dustwrappers very slightly rubbed and creased at the edges and head and tail of spine. Spines of dustwrapper slightly discoloured. Front and rear panels of dustwrappers clean and bright. ***208mm x 144mm. Volume I: 565 pages. Volume II: 516 pages. ***'And of all the men in our country, although we are of a thick-set breed, you scarce could find one in threescore fit to be placed among the Doones, without looking no more than a tailor. Like enough, we could meet them man for man (if we chose all around the crown and the skirts of Exmoor), and show them what a cross-buttock means, because we are so stuggy; but in regard of stature, comeliness, and bearing, no woman would look twice at us. Not but what I myself, John Ridd, and one or two I know of - but it becomes me best not to talk of that, although my hair is gray.' ***'Perhaps their den might well have been stormed, and themselves driven out of the forest, if honest people had only agreed to begin with them at once when first they took to plundering. But having respect for their good birth, and pity for their misfortunes, and perhaps a little admiration at the justice of God, that robbed men who were now robbers, the squires and farmers and shepherds at first did nothing more than grumble gently, or even make a laugh of it, each in the case of others. After a while they found the matter gone too far for laughter, as violence and deadly outrage stained the hand of robbery, until every woman clutched her child, and every man turned pale at the very name of "Doone".' [Quotes from Chapter V: An Illegal Settlement] ***An antiquarian, circa 1890 edition - a complete set of two volumes illustrated with tissue-guarded captioned, red-titled fine photographic illustrations throughout, some by Francis Frith & Co. All photographic illustrations to both volumes present, as called for. ***A very nice decorative gilt antiquarian set. Uncommon to find in the UK. ***For all our books, postage is charged at cost, allowing for packaging: any shipping rates indicated on ABE are an average only: we will reduce the P & P charge where appropriate - please contact us for postal rates for heavier books and sets etc.
